Iranian President on friendly relations with DPRK
    Pyongyang, January 7 (KCNA) -- The long-standing friendly and cooperative relations between Iran and the DPRK would remain unchanged in the Kim Jong Il era as in the lifetime of President Kim Il Sung, said Seyed Mohammad Khatami, President of the Islamic Republic of Iran, when receiving credentials from Kim Jong Nam, new DPRK ambassador e.p. to Iran, on Dec. 31 last year.
 Iran would remain a friend as ever and further expand and develop the friendly and cooperative relations with the DPRK in political, economic, cultural and all other fields, he stressed, expressing hope that the Korean people would achieve success in economic construction and the existing north-south agreements would lead to the reunification of Korea.
